div.p: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.
More information can be found at this website.

The EC-PHP plugin allows you to run any PHP script by writing it directly in the script area provided or execute it from a php file.
This plugin also allows you to interact with arguments and review the log after execution, just as the PHP compiler does.
This means that the log to be displayed will depend on the compiler installed and its capabilities to display error logs.
This plugin was developed and tested against version 5.3.
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.
This procedure allows you to execute php code from a text area or a php file and show the result in a log file

tr.td: The location of the PHP executable (e.g. C:\php-5.4.5-nts-Win32-VC9-x86).
Absolute path to a php file.
Enable the entry of arguments into the execution.
The arguments to be passed into the script.

div.p:
There are two ways to use this plugin to create php based steps. The first one is to write php code in the text area field and the other one is to execute a single php file.
